name: Bulbasaur
data:
Japanese

Breakdown

  • 不思議 (fushigi): mystery
  • だね (dane): isn't it? / 種 (-dane): seed

    • Translation: The play on words is 'mysterious, isn't it?' and 'mysterious seed'.

    Chinese

    Breakdown

    • 妙 (miào): wonderful, excellent
    • 蛙 (wā): frog
    • 種子 (zhǒngzǐ): seed

    Translation: 'Wonderful Frog Seed' or 'Magical Frog Seed'. The first two characters may also be phonetic, imitating the 'bulba-' part of Bulbasaur.

name: Ivysaur
data:
Japanese

Breakdown

  • 不思議 (fushigi): mystery
  • 草 (sou): grass / そう (sou): a suffix meaning 'it seems'

Translation: 'Seems mysterious' or 'mystery grass'.

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 妙 (miào): wonderful, excellent
  • 蛙 (wā): frog
  • 草 (cǎo): grass

Translation: 'Wonderful Frog Grass' or 'Magical Frog Grass'. Although this Ivysaur, the first two characters may also be phonetic, imitating the 'bulba-' part of Bulbasaur, its base evolution.

name: Venusaur
data:
Japanese

Breakdown

  • 不思議 (fushigi): mystery
  • 花 (-bana): flower

Translation: 'Mystery Flower'

Breakdown

  • 妙 (miào): wonderful, excellent
  • 蛙 (wā): frog
  • 花 (huā): flower

Translation: 'Wonderful Frog Flower' or 'Magical Frog Flower'. Although this is Venusaur, the first two characters may also be phonetic, imitating the 'bulba-' part of Bulbasaur, its base evolution.

name: Charmander
data:
Japanese

From 火 (hi): fire + 蜥蜴 (tokage): lizard → 火蜥蜴 (hitokage): salamander

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 小 (xiǎo): small, little
  • 火 (huǒ): fire
  • 龍 (lóng): dragon

Translation: 'Little Fire Dragon'

name: Charmeleon
data:
Japanese

リザード (rizaado): from English 'lizard'.

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 火 (huǒ): fire
  • 恐龍 (kǒnglóng): dinosaur (恐 (kǒng) means fearsome or frightening, 龍 (lóng) means dragon)

Translation: 'Fire Dinosaur' or 'Fearsome Fire Dragon'

name: Charizard
data:
Japanese

リザードン (rizaadon): from English 'lizard' + Greek suffix -don often used for dinosaurs.

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 噴 (pēn): spray, spout
  • 火 (huǒ): fire
  • 龍 (lóng): dragon

Translation: 'Spouting Fire Dragon' → 'Fire-breathing Dragon'

name: Squirtle
data:
Japanese

From 銭亀 zenigame, a type of baby spotted turtle.

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 傑 (jié): phonetic component
  • 尼 (ní): phonetic component
  • 龜 (guī): turtle

Translation: The first two letters are actually a phonetic translation of the Japanese name, ゼニガメ zenigame. The word zenigame refers to a type of Japanese turtle. So, combined, it means 'zeni-turtle'.

name: Wartortle
data:
Japanese

Breakdown

  • カメ (kame): turtle
  • English 'tail'

Translation: Tur-tail

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 卡 (kǎ): phonetic component
  • 咪 (mī): phonetic component
  • 龜 (guī): turtle

Translation: Phonetic-semantic compound meaning 'Kame-turtle'. The first two letters are a transliteration of the Japanese name カメール kameeru, which literally means 'tur-tail'.

name: Blastoise
data:
Japanese

Breakdown

  • カメ (kame): turtle
  • English 'max'

Translation: Tur-max

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 水 (shuǐ): water
  • 箭 (jiàn): arrow
  • 龜 (guī): turtle

Translation: 'Water Arrow Turtle'

name: Caterpie
data:
Japanese

From キャタピラー kyatapiraa 'caterpillar'.

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 綠 (lǜ): green
  • 毛 (máo): hair, fur + 蟲 (chóng): insect → 毛蟲: caterpillar

Translation: 'Green Furry Insect' or 'Green Caterpillar'

name: Metapod
data:
Japanese

Breakdown

  • トランスフォーム (toransufoomu) 'transform'
  • セル (seru) 'cell'

Translation: Trans-cell. Alternatively, a play on the word ランドセル randoseru 'school bag'.

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 鐵 (tiě): iron
  • 甲 (jiǎ): armor
  • 蛹 (yǒng): chrysalis

Translation: Iron Armored Chrysalis

name: Butterfree
other: 巴大蝴 Bādàhú (TW/CN), 巴他蝶 Bātādihp (HK)
data:
Japanese

Breakdown

  • バタ (bata): from Japanese onomatopoeia パタパタ 'patapata' meaning 'flutter'
  • フリー (furii): 1. English 'free', 2. from 振り (furi) 'shake, wave' / 'appearance'

Translation: Could be derived from English 'butterfly' + 'free', or a combination of the Japanese terms above.

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 巴 (bā): transliteration
  • 大 (dà): big
  • 蝶 (dié): butterfly

Translation: from Japanese バター and Chinese for 'butterfly'.

name: Weedle
data:
Japanese

ビードル (biidoru): from ビー (bii)'bee' + ニードル (niidoru) 'needle'.

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 獨 (dú): single
  • 角 (jiǎo): horn
  • 蟲 (chóng): insect

Translation: Unicorn Insect

name: Kakuna
other: 鐵殼昆 / 铁壳昆 Tiěkékūn (TW/CN)
data:
Japanese

コクーン kokuun from English 'cocoon'.

Chinese

Breakdown

  • 鐵 (tiě): iron
  • 殼 (kè): shell
  • 昆 (kūn): insect

Translation: 'Iron Shelled Insect'. The last two characters are also partly coincidentally phonetic, sounding like English 'cocoon'.
